page.title: 13Fruit Farming in Coxheath
page.content:
The majority of farming in this area is fruit farming, mainly apples; both cooking and eating. There are also soft fruits. Casual labour is employed for picking. Originally there were many small farms but now most of the orchards are owned by a few large farms; houses and buildings having been sold off with a small plot of land.
Some of the orchards are irrigated from specially constructed reservoirs. In one large orchard, grafting has been done as the root stock is still good. Another large orchard has had the ground sprayed. This has killed all life on the ground and drift to the hedgerows has also resulted in the death of wild plants. We asked ourselves if this will lead to the creation of a dustbowl in Coxheath.
